background: A farmer is transporting cows to a nearby farm and must decide on the mix of helicopters and trucks to use based on the capacity of each transport type and their associated pollution levels to minimize the total pollution produced.
constraints: Number of helicopter trips is non-negative
Number of truck trips is non-negative
Total number of cows transported is at least TotalCows
Total number of truck trips is at most MaxTruckTrips
objective: Minimize the total amount of pollution produced by the transportation of cows
description: A farmer decides to move his cows to a nearby farm using helicopters and trucks. A helicopter can take \param{CowsPerHelicopter} cows per trip and creates \param{PollutionPerHelicopter} units of pollution. A truck can take \param{CowsPerTruck} cows per trip and creates \param{PollutionPerTruck} units of pollution. The farmer needs to transport \param{TotalCows} cows and he only has enough money for at most \param{MaxTruckTrips} truck trips. How many of each type of trip should be taken to minimize the total amount of pollution produced?

parameters.definition: Number of cows per helicopter trip
Pollution units created by one helicopter trip
Number of cows per truck trip
Pollution units created by one truck trip
Total number of cows to transport
Maximum number of truck trips allowed
